vision.notes: Sensory capabilities of Gorgoniidae are not detailed in the provided context. Vision presence and capabilities are therefore unknown.

chemoreception.notes: As soft corals, Gorgoniidae likely rely on chemoreception for detecting food and environmental cues. This is inferred based on the commonality of chemoreception in similar marine invertebrates.

mechanoreception.notes: As sessile organisms in aquatic environments, Gorgoniidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect water currents and other physical stimuli.
